intro: Nashia cayensis, commonly known as the Cayenne Nashia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Nashia cayensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
